dialogue.utterance: Train goes at four minutes past twelve. You've just got time.

dialogue.utterance: That's very kind of somebody. Who do I have to thank? What happens if I miss the train?

dialogue.utterance: I've been asked to make sure you don't.

dialogue.context: The front passenger door starts to open. Carter grabs it and pulls it wide open. With all his force, he slams it against the man as he gets out. The window shatters over his head. Blood spurts everywhere. The driver panics. He accelerates away as the man in the back is getting out. His foot is trapped in a safety belt. He's upended and dragged along the tarmac, his head dangerously close to the back wheel. His yells make the driver brake. In the confusion Thorpe escapes from the car and makes off. Carter spots him and begins to run.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Thorpe turns into the main road. He makes for the dance hall and disappears inside. Carter follows.

ALBERT
CARTER
dialogue.utterance: Did Eric know that Frank was my brother?
dialogue.speaker: ALBERT
CARTER
ALBERT
dialogue.context: They drove Frank away in a car.
dialogue.utterance: 'Good.' Albert draws deeply on his cigarette.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Albert nods.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Carter takes something from his pocket. There's a loud click. It's a. knife.
dialogue.speaker: ALBERT
dialogue.context: He falls to his knees.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
ALBERT
dialogue.context: Carter drives the knife into him with all his might.
dialogue.utterance: Yes, but listen. Christ, I didn't kill him.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: A ship's horn calls mournfully from the harbour. Albert leans back. Blood seeps from his chest. He pitches forward, twitches, and is dead.
dialogue.utterance: I know you didn't kill him. I know you didn't.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.utterance: No shooters. Cyril said no shooters, you stupid bastard.
dialogue.speaker: PETER
CON
dialogue.utterance: Gerald wants to see him first.
dialogue.speaker: PETER
dialogue.context: Carter is listening to all this.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric laughs.
dialogue.utterance: Are you coming in? Or do we piss about all day?
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.utterance: You're finished, Jack. You know that, don't you? I've bloody finished you.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric laughs.
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.utterance: Oh, you've still got your sense of humour? Tell him how I've fixed him, Con.
dialogue.speaker: CON
dialogue.utterance: He's told Gerald about you and Anna.
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.utterance: Didn't believe us at first, did he, Con? Then Peter talked to him.
dialogue.speaker: PETER
dialogue.utterance: Didn't even say goodbye. Just asked us to take you back - alive.
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.context: Carter shows no emotion. Or are his eyes just that bit sadder? Peter lets rip again. Another window is shattered. Carter ducks back, allowing Peter time to board the ferry. Carter catches a glimpse of Peter as he climbs up the ferry's superstructure to the roof. By the time he heaves himself into position, Carter is waiting.
dialogue.utterance: He's probably talking to her right now. Are you still going to fancy her when Gerald's finished with her face?
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Peter is helpless, clinging to the roof, unable to even raise his shooter.
dialogue.speaker: PETER
dialogue.context: There's a long pause while Carter looks at him, then he cold-bloodedly shoots. Peter is blown away. By the time he hits the deck, he's dead. Con and Eric panic. They run up the gangplank, safely out of range.
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.context: Eric signals to the driver in the Land Rover to bump the Sunbeam into the water. Two hits and the task is done. Glenda's screams are lost as the river wraps itself around the sinking car. Carter watches impassively.
dialogue.utterance: Carter, your car needs a wash.

dialogue.speaker: BRUMBY
dialogue.utterance: I don't want them cooking in here. You can put a hatch in that wall.
dialogue.speaker: INTERIOR DECORATOR
dialogue.context: The sound of a car screeching up the ramps interrupts him.
dialogue.utterance: Yes, it's all a question of ...
dialogue.speaker: BRUMBY
dialogue.context: He strides away to investigate.
dialogue.utterance: Who in Christ's name is that? It's a bloody madman.

dialogue.speaker: BRUMBY
dialogue.context: Carter slams his fist hard into his gut.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.utterance: You shouldn't have shown the film to Frank.
dialogue.speaker: BRUMBY
dialogue.utterance: I had to. It was the only way I could get at them.

dialogue.speaker: FIRST WOMAN
dialogue.utterance: They don't know how it happened.

dialogue.speaker: SECOND WOMAN
dialogue.utterance: Better to go quick like that.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.context: Kinnear crosses to the telephone.
dialogue.utterance: Gerald Fletcher wants a word with you Cyril.
dialogue.speaker: KINNEAR
CARTER
dialogue.utterance: It's Carter. Listen carefully, you hairy-faced git. I've got the film and enough evidence to put you away for a long time. All it takes is one call to the police.
dialogue.speaker: KINNEAR
CARTER
dialogue.utterance: I'll do a simple deal with you. All I want is ...

dialogue.speaker: KINNEAR
dialogue.context: Kinnear continues listening.
dialogue.utterance: I see. I think that can be arranged.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Carter hangs up. He pushes Margaret towards the car.
dialogue.utterance: ... but I don't want him there until six in the morning. OK? Right.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
KINNEAR
dialogue.utterance: Yes, Eric. A word with you.

dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Carter and Margaret get out. They appear in the beam of the headlights and move further into the wood.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Margaret is confused. Take your clothes off. Margaret does just that: coat, blouse, skin. She goes to remove her knickers.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: He kneels on her, pinning her arms with his knees, then stuffs a gag in her mouth. He takes out the hypodermic, places it against her arm, and injects the heroin into her. She struggles, her eyes moving frantically about. She screams, but its muffled by the gag. Carter holds her down and she quickly goes under. Carter removes the gag. He stands, picks her up and walks into the darkness with Margaret in his arms.
dialogue.utterance: Keep your pants on. Lie down. Again she obeys.

dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.utterance: You couldn't win an egg and spoon race, Eric.
dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.context: Paice darts down another staircase to ground level and makes for the roadway. Carter stops above the roadway. Below, Paice makes for the parked car. Carter holds the gun up. Eric stops and looks up.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric darts under the jetty. Carter runs on down the steps. He can see Eric scampering along the row of cottages towards the beach. Carter starts after him.
dialogue.utterance: Stay away from the car or I'll blow you apart.

dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric just manages it. Carter pulls the bottle of Scotch out of his pocket.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: He throws the bottle to Eric.
dialogue.utterance: I bet you could use a drink, could you, Eric?
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
ERIC
dialogue.context: Eric takes the cap off and looks at Carter. He's in a terrible state.
dialogue.utterance: Still got your sense of humour.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric pours the whisky into his month. It spills over and runs down his face.
dialogue.utterance: Drink up, Eric. Drink up. I want you to drink all of that. Do you understand? Drink up. Just like it was with my brother, Frank. Go on, son. Drink up.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric begins to stagger about.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric takes a breather and looks pathetically at Carter. No mercy there.
dialogue.utterance: It was you who poured it down him. Eh, Eric?
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: It's disgusting to watch. Suddenly, he retches, but nothing comes up.
dialogue.utterance: Did you all have a good laugh, eh? Did you have a good laugh when he was spewing it up? The whisky is pouring all over Eric's face and suit.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Eric is choking.
dialogue.utterance: Drink it! Drink it! Did you all pass the bottle round after the car went over the top?
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Carter leans forward and with his free hand lifts the bottle up to Eric's mouth again. In the other, he holds the shotgun. Eric chokes and retches. Carter has seen enough.
dialogue.speaker: CARTER
dialogue.context: Carter raises the butt of the gun and brings it down on Eric's head.
